title: 112_hr6040
content: The Act is titled the "Continued Free Association with Palau Act of 2012" and amends Title I of Public Law 99-658 by adding a section for the 15th-anniversary review agreement. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed in 2010, is approved with exceptions and subject to provisions. Funding provisions include infrastructure maintenance and a fiscal consolidation fund. The Agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau, signed in 2010, includes provisions for a fiscal consolidation fund and infrastructure projects. Congress consents to amendments to subsidiary agreements, and there is authorization of appropriations for postal services. The Department of the Interior is allocated $1,500,000 annually from 2012 to 2024 for postal services in Palau, the Federated States of Micronesia, and the Marshall Islands. Funds can be transferred to the United States Postal Service for this purpose. Appropriations for Federal entities under the Compact of Free Association can continue until 2024 and are subject to full faith and credit commitments. The United States commits to funding audits and oversight for Palau under the Compact Review Agreement. The Government of Palau is deemed eligible for certain U.S. domestic programs. The Secretary of the Interior must submit an annual report to specific Congressional committees regarding financial assistance under the Compact. The Secretary of the Interior must provide an annual report to Congress on the effectiveness of financial assistance given to Palau under U.S. domestic programs, consulting with relevant federal agencies. SEC. 3. OFFSETS. Repeals prior authorization for civil administration of Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands and adds a limitation on the use of funds for global health programs under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. SEC. 136. LIMITATION ON USE OF FUNDS. None of the funds for global health activities from fiscal year 2012 to 2024 can be used for assistance to China. The total amount for global health activities is reduced by $2,000,000 each fiscal year. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. ``(a) Limitation.--Funds for climate change activities from 2012 to 2024 cannot be used for assistance to China. The total amount for these activities is reduced by $4,500,000 each fiscal year. This section applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. (d) Prohibition on Funding for Development Innovation Ventures (DIV) Program.--Funds for 2012 and 2013 to USAID cannot be used for the DIV program or any successor program.'' In fiscal years 2012 to 2024, funds for Foreign Assistance Act activities cannot be used to assist Argentina. The total amount available for these activities is reduced by $4,500,000 each fiscal year. This limitation applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. The subsection applies regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment. SEC. 308. LIMITATION ON USE OF FUNDS. SEC. 308 imposes limitations on the use of funds for United States contributions to the United Nations and the United States Institute of Peace. For fiscal years 2012 through 2024, funds for UN contributions are restricted, with a reduction of $4,500,000 annually. Similarly, funds for the US Institute of Peace are limited by $6,811,000 annually during the same period. The subsection imposes limitations on the total amount available for fiscal year purposes, regardless of any other laws enacted after its enactment.
